info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 13 at 1:30PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A THUNDERSTORM WITH INTENSE LIGHTNING AND TORRENTIAL RAINFALL WILL IMPACT NORTHWESTERN HABERSHAM AND SOUTHWESTERN RABUN COUNTIES UNTIL 200 PM EDT... At 130 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a thunderstorm with intense lightning and torrential rainfall 10 miles north of Clarkesville, or 5 miles south of Lake Burton, moving northeast at 10 mph. Locations to be impacted include... Lake Burton, Lake Rabun, Seed Lake and Batesville. Very heavy rainfall rates up to 2 inches per hour will be possible in these areas.
info.instruction: Frequent lightning is occurring with this storm. If outdoors, try to get indoors or into a hard topped vehicle. Otherwise, stay away from open areas and isolated high objects such as trees. When indoors, stay away from windows and doors and avoid using wired electronic devices. Do not take a shower or bath. Try to unplug unnecessary appliances before the storm approaches.
